# Introduction

---

# The First Photographs

The first photographs were made in the early 19th century using a process called heliography.

---

# The Daguerreotype

In 1839, Louis Daguerre introduced the daguerreotype process, which produced highly detailed and polished images on silver-plated copper sheets.

---

# The Collodion Process

In the 1850s, the collodion process was developed, which allowed for faster exposure times and the production of glass plate negatives.
